column2: Dish's $3 bln wireless auction discount up for U.S. regulator review WASHINGTON
column3: Jan 30 U.S. regulators will review a $3 billion discount claimed by Dish Network Corp and partners including investment management company BlackRock Inc  during a U.S. government wireless spectrum auction that ended this week. ~

column2: Chevron to stop its shale gas exploration in Poland WARSAW
column3: Jan 31 U.S. energy major Chevron Corp  said it will stop exploring for shale gas in Poland
column4: a sector that has failed to live up to its early promise of transforming eastern Europe's energy supplies. ~

column2: CORRECTED-IBM brings back bonuses for top execs even as profits slide SEATTLE
column3: Jan 30 International Business Machines Corp brought back annual performance bonuses for its chief executive and her top lieutenants for 2014 despite falling profits and a tumbling stock price
column4: a regulatory filing showed on Friday. ~

column2: McDonald's to slow Russia expansion due to fall in rouble MOSCOW
column3: Jan 31 McDonald's Corp. will open fewer new restaurants in Russia this year than last because a fall in the rouble has increased expansion costs and is hurting consumers
column4: its Russian chief executive Khamzat Khasbulatov told Reuters. ~
